# Draft:Lê Đình Lượng Human Rights Award

----
= Lê Đình Lượng Human Rights Award =
The Lê Đình Lượng Human Rights Award is an annual award presented to individuals and/or organizations advocating for human rights in Vietnam. The award was established in 2018 by Việt Tân and is named after Vietnamese human rights defender and environmental activist Lê Đình Lượng.
Background
Lê Đình Lượng is a pro-democratic activist, blogger, and journalist. He was arrested in July 2017, and charged under Article 79 of Vietnam's Penal code for "activities attempting to overthrow the state." On August 16, 2018, a court in Nghe An province sentenced Le Dinh Luong to 20 years in prison for his peaceful activities. His work included supporting victims of the 2016 Formosa toxic spill incident, which devastated the livelihood of thousands of Vietnamese fishermen and farmers.  Viet Tan created the draw attention to the egregious sentencing of Le Dinh Luong, to recognize courageous activists, and to highlight ongoing human rights violations in Vietnam.
Lê Đình Lượng has been on a hunger strike since May 2025, his current condition is unknown as his family has not been allowed to visit and prison officials are silent about his current health and solitary confinement status.
Recepients
2024 - Y Krec Bya
[https://the88project.org/profile/625/y-krec-bya/ Y Krec Bya] is a Montagnard evangelical missionary and human rights activist from Vietnam’s central highlands. He advocates for religious freedom and justice for the indigenous Montagnard community. He was arrested in 2023, under the charges of “sabotaging national unity”. He was previously imprisoned in 2004 for similar charges. His work includes documenting human rights violations and garnering international awareness. In May 2025, Bya was named the “Prisoner of the Month” by The German Section of the International Society for Human Rights (ISHR) and the Evangelical News Agency IDEA to highlight his ongoing detention and inhumane treatment.
2023 - Trương Văn Dũng
Trương Văn Dũng is a Vietnamese activist known for his advocacy of land rights, freedom of expression, association, assembly, and support of other prisoners of conscience. He became a prominent activist for his advocacy against China’s continued occupation of the Paracel Islands and for supporting the victims of the 2016 Formosa Toxic Spill. He was arrested in 2023 for “conducting propaganda against the state” under article 88 of Vietnam’s 1999 Penal Code. On March 28, 2023, Truong Van Dung was sentenced to 6 years in prison.
2022 - Nguyễn Năng Tĩnh
[https://the88project.org/profile/376/nguyen-nang-tinh/ Nguyễn Năng Tĩnh] is a Vietnamese Catholic music teacher and human rights activist known for his pro-democracy advocacy and criticism of the Vietnamese government. He is a member of various organizations and has used his platform to address issues such as the Formosa toxic spill. He was arrested on May 29, 2019 with “making, storing, spreading information, materials, items for the purpose of opposing the State” under Article 117 of Vietnam’s Penal Code. On November 15, 2019, he was sentenced to 11 years in prison for his allegedly “anti-state” Facebook posts.
2021 - Đặng Hữu Nam
Đặng Hữu Nam is a Vietnamese Catholic priest and human rights activist known for his advocacy for social justice and environmental rights, as shown by his advocacy on behalf of victims of the 2016 Formosa toxic spill. Father Nam used his sermons, social media, and public protests to criticize the Vietnamese government’s handling of the disaster and its suppression of dissent, accusing authorities of corruption and collusion with Formosa Plastics Ha Tinh. Since 2021, Father Nam has been prohibited from performing religious duties, including rites and pastoral care.  His mobility, access to food, health care, and other rights have been restricted.
2020 - Phan Kim Khánh
Phan Kim Khánh is a Vietnamese student and blogger. He has been recognized for his human rights activism through blogging and social media. A student of International Relations at Thai Nguyen University, he founded a student club for volunteer work and was active in the university’s student association. He was arrested on March 21, 2017 and charged under Article 88 of Vietnam’s Penal Code for “conducting propaganda against the state.” On October 25, 2017, after a 4-hour trial, Khanh was sentenced to 6 years in prison.  He was released on March 21, 2023.
2019 - Nguyễn Thúy Hạnh
Nguyễn Thúy Hạnh is a prominent Vietnamese human rights activist and blogger from Hanoi, known for her advocacy for prisoners of conscience and victims of land grab. She founded the 50K Fund in 2018 to support families of political prisoners. On April 7, 2021, Hạnh was arrested at her home in Hanoi under Article 117 of Vietnam’s Penal Code for “anti-state propaganda,” facing up to 20 years in prison. Nguyễn Thúy Hạnh remained in pretrial detention without an official conviction until a closed trial on July 31, 2024, sentencing her to 3 years and 6 months in prison, roughly equal to her time in detention.  She was released on October 7, 2024.
2018 - Trần Thị Nga
Trần Thị Nga is a Vietnamese human rights activist known for her advocacy for labor rights, land rights, and freedom of expression. A member of the Vietnamese Women for Human Rights, she documented police brutality and government abuses on social media platforms. Her activism began after experiencing exploitation as a migrant worker in Taiwan, where she was injured in a 2005 traffic accident, she learned about workers’ rights during this time. Nga participated in anti-China protests, pro-environment demonstrations, and solidarity visits to political prisoners, while also attending trials of bloggers and activists. She was arrested on January 21, 2017, and was charged with “conducting propaganda against the state” under Article 88 of Vietnam’s Penal Code. Nga was sentenced to 9 years in prison followed by 5 years of house arrest.  She was released on January 10, 2020 and was immediately exiled to the United States.
